title: Fifteen
features: Uprising in the world of 1967; Upheaval in a Bronx home!A lively story set in the Bronx, in a time of conflicting emotions—light-hearted expressions of freedom, and angry displays of turbulence. In this Italian-American household, young mother, Maria, married to grumpy Luigi who is fifteen years older, searches for a way out of her stale life; while her daughter, Angelina, a typical teen, struggles to find herself during this turbulent era. Since the mother and daughter are often mistaken for sisters, problems develop, especially when Pasquale, the sultry Italian stallion enters the picture. Sparks fly and nothing in the Campisi family is ever the same again.
description: ...the characters are compelling and well-drawn, and the story moves at a quick clip...An entertaining novel that paints a fine portrait of 1960s New York. --Kirkus Reviews

Carolyn Doyle, a former fashion designer in NYC's fashion district, has used many of her fashion industry experiences to develop plots and characters in this, her first novel, Fifteen. This is the first in a series of four novels set in and around the Garment Center between 1967 and 2001. The second novel in the series, Dance to Fashion, is set to release in 2015. Carolyn is a graduate of the Fashion Institute of Technology in NYC. In addition, she earned a Certificate in Screenwriting from New York University, and is a previous student of Creative Writing at The New School in NYC.
